articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two children were among those hospitalised, one of them in a serious condition.
articles.title: Seven killed after bridge collapse, train derailment in Russia's Bryansk region bordering Ukraine

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Armed men hijacked dozens of aid trucks entering the Gaza Strip overnight.
articles.title: Gaza aid supplies hit by looting as Hamas ceasefire response awaited

articles.author: Greg Torode, Fanny Potkin
articles.description: At Shangri-La Dialogue, the US urges EU to focus on Europe—Europe pushes back, asserting Asia-Pacific ties.
articles.title: Europe bristles at US proposals at Asian gathering, India-Pakistan hostility on show

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.description: Mexicans vote on Sunday in the country's first ever judicial elections, part of an overhaul of the nation's judiciary that critics warn could jeopardize the rule of law.
articles.title: Mexico votes in first judicial election amid concerns over rule of law

articles.author: Andrew Chung
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court swept away this week another obstacle to one of President Donald Trump's most aggressively pursued policies - mass deportation - again showing its willingness to back his hardline approach to immigration. The justices, though, have signaled some reservations with how he is carrying it out.
articles.title: Trump gets key wins at Supreme Court on immigration, despite some misgivings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran previously carried out secret nuclear activities with material not declared to the U.N. nuclear watchdog at three locations that have long been under investigation, the watchdog said in a wide-ranging, confidential report to member states seen by Reuters.
articles.title: IAEA report says Iran had secret activities with undeclared nuclear material

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five Jewish institutions were sprayed with green paint in Paris overnight and an investigation has been opened, a police source said on Saturday.
articles.title: Several Paris Jewish institutions sprayed with green paint

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China has protested to the United States over "vilifying" remarks made by Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, the foreign ministry said on Sunday, while accusing it of deliberately ignoring calls for peace from regional nations.
articles.title: China accuses US's Hegseth of 'vilifying' remarks at security forum

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian authorities will continue searching on Sunday for eight people trapped in a rock collapse at a quarry in West Java, where the death toll has reached 17 with six injured, the search and rescue agency Basarnas said.
articles.title: Search continues for Indonesia quarry collapse victims, death toll at 17

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Heavy rainfall triggering flash floods and mudslides have damaged roads, destroyed buildings and claimed bridges, wreaking havoc in China's southwestern Yunnan province on a long holiday weekend.
articles.title: China's Yunnan hit with floods, mudslides from intense rains
